description: Change of use from Class C3 (Residential Dwelling) to Class C4 (Houses in Multiple Occupation) for 5 persons (Application for a Certificate of Lawful Development for a Proposed Development)
decision_conditions: Due to the internal size of the bedrooms, the HMO would have an occupancy level of above 6 persons and would be classed as a large HMO (Sui Generis) use that would require the submission of a full planning application. As such it would fail to meet Class L, Schedule 2, Part 3 of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development)Order 2015.

Due to the undersized internal dimensions of Bedroom 3, the HMO would provide its future occupiers with a substandard form of living accommodation. As such it would fail to meet Class L, Schedule 2, Part 3 of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development)Order 2015.
